content.description:
Rimrete, V5

start sitting left hand on the blocky hold right on the crimp under the face, pull on and use a knee bar to slap to the arete. Make a big move to the lip. Much fun!
Sit start on a good crimp rail and power over the bulge using more crimps and a few holds more on the juggy side. Short but good movement with multiple ways of pulling the crux.
content.location: Six feet or so to the right of Humbaba

content.description: The right arete of The Constant Gardener dihedral. Sit start with a good hold on the arete for the left and a sidepull pinch for the right. Continue straight up the arete. Most excellent!
content.protection: A pad and a spotter, I slightly improved the landing however if you blew the upper layback you might spin off a bit funny.
content.location: On the right arete of the Constant Gardener Dihedral.

content.description: A short bulge up the right side of the cave. An okay problem, unaesthetic but fun enough.
content.location: Located to the West (Left if facing up the hill) of the Garden area, this problem is located on the right most protrusion of a small cave.

content.description: The crack at the back of the cave. Funky sit start which moves quickly to a short fingers section (One or two locks) to a hand jam over the roof. A bit burly and a little dirty, it should clean up nicely.
content.location: To the left of The Hobbit, its about 12 feet left of the large overhanging boulder.

content.description: An excellent dihedral! A few stemming moves leading to a juggy finish.
content.location: From the pull out head east along CA-44 for approximately 40 feet, then head across the road toward the cliff band, passing a large chossy, orange lichen covered overhanging face until you spot the dihedral, a bit hard to miss as the area is rather small.

content.description: Pull on to the suspended boulder via a step like hold on the left in the cave. campus to a small finger bucket and up to the lip. using a toe hook to stay on, match the lip and work your way around to the right. Good holds but a tenuous slightly scary top out!

With your left hand on a pinchy side pull and right in a 2/3 finger pocket, pull on and make a tuff move to a small crimp slot. fix your feet and pull hard to another crimp on the left face. hop to good hold and pull the lip!
